data.title: The Obamas Light Their Last Christmas Tree As The First Family
data.meta_description: The star-studded holiday event felt like a heartwarming farewell. üå≤
data.text:
The star-studded holiday event felt like a heartwarming farewell. üå≤

The Obamas lit up the start of the holiday season for their last time as the first family of the United States, and they did it with the help of a few sparkling friends.

A parade of celebrities joined Michelle, Sasha and President Barack Obama on Thursday to ring in the season during the 94th Annual National Christmas Tree Lighting at the White House‚Äôs President‚Äôs Park.

Advertisement

The ceremony, which has been held every year since President Calvin Coolidge began it in 1923, was hosted by actress Eva Longoria.

Some of the country‚Äôs most celebrated musical artists from nearly every genre came to celebrate with the Obamas, with performances by Kelly Clarkson, Chance the Rapper, Marc Anthony, Garth Brooks and Trisha Yearwood, and The Lumineers.

Obama used the ceremony‚Äôs closing remarks to urge the country to love and accept every single person, regardless of faith or race.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a message of unity and a message of decency and a message of hope that never goes out of style. And it‚Äôs one that we all need very much today,‚Äù Obama told the crowd. ‚ÄúAfter eight years as your president, I still believe that there is so much more that unites us than divides us.‚Äù

Advertisement

The traditional ceremony was as wholesome as it was glamorous, with a reading of ‚ÄúA Visit From St. Nicholas‚Äù by the first lady and Simone Manuel, the first female African-American swimmer to win an Olympic gold medal.

This year‚Äôs tree-lighting marks the last time the Obamas will participate in the White House tradition. Next year‚Äôs presidential tree lighting will likely be hosted by the Trump family.

Below, watch the Obamas host their final national tree lighting.
